description: 1 x Mature Oak (applicants ref. T1) -Reduce limbs overhanging penthouse roof terrace area by up to 3 metre branch lengths; remove any remaining dead and defective branchwood. Standing in Group G2 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x oak Duel-stemmed Oak (applicants ref. T2) Duel-stemmed  on east boundary: Selectively reduce lateral growth on upper crown (West side of tree, towards property only) by up to 2.5 metres to provide more light into property; die back on these extremities of many of these branches, so this will improve the general aesthetic; maintain natural flowing canopy outline; remove any dead and defective branchwood.   Standing in Group G2 of Tree Preservation Order. (Amended description)1 x Mature Cedar (applicants ref. T3) - Reduce branches overhanging property by up to 2.5 metre branch lengths to provide clearance from roof terrace; remove any dead and defective branchwood. Standing in Group G2 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Hornbeam (applicants ref. T4) - Reduce away from building by branch lengths up to 1.5 metres to provide clearance; Reduce upper crown on south side of tree by up to 2 metres to provide better site-lines to the garden from the Penthouse; strip dead ivy; remove any dead and defective branchwood. Standing in Group G2 of Tree Preservation Order.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: Det affect health and app of tree
